# JOINT USE AGREEMENT
BETWEEN
THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY
AND

## EDISON WELDING INSTITUTE

THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered into as of the 1st day of April, 1995, by and between THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY ("the University") and EDISON WELDING INSTITUTE (EWI") for the purpose of delineating the joint use of welding and joining equipment ("the Equipment") to be located in the Edison Joining Technology Center which is to be constructed by EWI in the University's Research Park in Columbus, Ohio.

## WITNESSETH:

WHEREAS, the University was instrumental in the establishment of EWI in 1984 for the purpose of assisting Ohio and U.S. industry in the field of materials joining technology; and

WHEREAS, subsequent cooperation between the two organizations has been extensive and mutually beneficial; and

WHEREAS, EWI has grown to the extent that its original building located in the University's Research Park will no longer accommodate all of its programs; and

WHEREAS, the University and EWI wish to facilitate further growth and cooperation by developing an expanded Facility for EWI in the University Research Park, to be named the Edison Joining Technology Center (the "Facility"); and

WHEREAS, the Facility will house both EWI and significant components of the University's Welding Engineering Program, as well as the Equipment; and

WHEREAS, the Ohio General Assembly of the State of Ohio through the FY 95 capital bill, Substitute House Bill No. 790 appropriated Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000) to the University toward the cost of the Facility.

NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual benefits hereunder, the parties hereby agree to the following terms and conditions.

## TERMS AND CONDITIONS

## SECTION 1. GENERAL PROVISIONS

a. The Equipment will be located throughout the Facility, which will be constructed on a parcel of land at the intersection of Carmack Road and Lane Avenue in The Ohio State University Research Park in the City of Columbus, Franklin County, Ohio.

BE2-1138161-1
3/30/95

b. The University will enter into a long term lease with EWI, which will construct the Facility with University and private funds.

C. EWI shall be responsible for the operation and maintenance of the Facility and for insuring it against casualty and liability, as provided in the said long term lease and the other agreements to be entered into between the parties ("the Other Agreements").

## SECTION 2. EXTENT AND NATURE OF USE BY UNIVERSITY

a. The Administrative Committee as defined in the Other Agreements shall identify equipment owned by EWI in the areas of (1) resistance and forge welding, (2) mechanical testing, (3) microjoining, and (4) plastics joining, which equipment will have a present value equal to the amount of the aforesaid appropriation of state funds ($2,000,000). Said equipment will be known as "the Equipment". From time to time, the Administrative Committee may review and modify the list of the Equipment, identifying additional or different areas of equipment in order to insure that the value of the Equipment remains at $2,000,000 and continues to be relevant to the University's instructional program.

b. The University shall be entitled to utilize the Equipment for instructional purposes.

C. The terms of the University's use of the Equipment shall be commensurate with the aforesaid appropriation of state funds, and more favorable to the University than to any other user.

d. EWI will be responsible for the maintenance of the Equipment.

e. The University's use of the Equipment shall be in lieu of any free use of the Facility, although the parties acknowledge that the aforesaid appropriation of state funds towards construction of the Facility will allow the University to lease space in the Facility at a below market rental rate.

## SECTION 3. TERM

This Agreement shall become effective upon its execution by the parties hereto, and shall remain effective during the entire initial term of the said long term lease.

## SECTION 4. REIMBURSEMENT TO STATE UPON TERMINATION

In the event that the University's right to utilize the Equipment located throughout the Facility is terminated by EWI prior to the expiration of fifteen (15) years from the date of commencement of the University's use of the Equipment, the State of Ohio shall be partially reimbursed. Such reimbursement shall be calculated by dividing the amount of the aforesaid appropriation of state funds by fifteen (15) and multiplying that sum by fifteen (15) less the number of years since the commencement of the said use. Termination shall not occur for purposes of this section by reason of a casualty loss to the Equipment or the Facility if same are replaced or rebuilt pursuant to the

2

Other Agreements. This clause shall not effect or diminish any other remedy of the University pursuant to law.

## SECTION 5. INDEMNIFICATION OF THE UNIVERSITY

The University shall have no liability for, and EWI shall indemnify and hold the University harmless from any and all costs, liabilities and claims that arise from or are related to the construction, operation and maintenance costs of the Facility, except for (1) claims arising out of the breach by the University of any agreement between the parties, (2) the University's obligation to pay the said expenses of maintenance and operation as provided in the Other Agreements, and (3) claims arising out of the negligence of the University, its employees, agents, students or guests..

## SECTION 6. BIDDING PROCEDURES

In the expenditure of state capital appropriations, EWI shall follow competitive bidding procedures which include, as a minimum, publishing advertisements to seek bids, receiving sealed bids, and awarding contracts to the lowest responsive and responsible bidders.

## SECTION 7. REIMBURSEMENT TO THE UNIVERSITY.

The University shall be reimbursed for administrative costs incurred as a result of the Facility project. The reimbursement shall be up to one and one-half percent (1 1/2%) of the total amount appropriated to the University by the State of Ohio for construction of the Facility(i.e. $30,000).

## SECTION 8. USE OF FUNDS FOR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS

The funds appropriated for the Facility by the State of Ohio shall be used only for capital improvements as defined in Amended Substitute House Bill 790.

## SECTION 9. COMPLIANCE WITH LAWS

EWI shall comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and administrative regulations.

## SECTION 10. DISTRIBUTION OF FUNDS

Upon execution of this AGREEMENT, the University shall submit to the Ohio Board of Regents a formal request for release of the two million dollars ($2,000,000) appropriated for the Facility by the State of Ohio in Amended Substitute House Bill 790. After release and encumbrance of the funds, the University shall seek disbursements therefrom as herein provided. EWI shall submit to the University requests for payments of amounts due for contracted work, along with documentation (a) that the cost has been properly incurred and is appropriately chargeable to the total construction costs, and (b) that the work meets the applicable specifications of the State of Ohio, the University and this agreement, on or after the times the work is completed. Such requests shall not be submitted more than once per month. Payment of the University's

3

administrative fee shall be deducted and made to the University as funds are released by the State of Ohio.

## SECTION 11. NOTICES

All notices to the parties shall be addressed to the parties at the addresses set forth below, or to such other address as either party, or its attorney, shall have designated by notice given in accordance with toe provisions of this paragraph. All notices shall be addressed and mailed, postage prepaid, by certified mail, or delivered as follows: To EWI:

EDISON WELDING INSTITUTE
1100 Kinnear Road
Columbus, Ohio 43212
Attention: Executive Director

To the University:

THE OHIO STATE University 190 North Oval Mall, Room 108 Columbus, Ohio 43210 Attention: Vice President for Business and Administration

## SECTION 12. AMENDMENTS

All amendments to this Agreement shall be in writing and signed by the parties and shall require the prior approval of the University Board of Trustees, EWI, and the Ohio Board of Regents.

## SECTION 13. BINDING NATURE

This agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of EWI and the University and their respective successors and assigns. Provided, however, neither party shall assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party.

## SECTION 14. ENTIRE AGREEMENT

This Agreement sets forth the entire agreement of the parties concerning the Equipment, except for the Other Agreements.

## SECTION 15. DEFAULT

Neither party shall be in default or breach of this Agreement unless it fails to perform or observe any covenant, term or condition required of it within thirty (30) days after the other party gives written notice of same. If, however, the same cannot reasonably be performed in such thirty (30) day period, a party will not be in default or breach of this Agreement if it commences performance

4

or observance within such thirty (30) day period, and thereafter diligently proceeds to complete the performance of observance.

## SECTION 16. NO WAIVER

No failure by either party to insist upon the strict performance by the other of any covenant, term or condition of this Agreement or to exercise any right or remedy contingent upon a breach thereof shall constitute a waiver of such breach or of such covenant, term or condition, and this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect with respect to any other then existing or subsequent breach.

## SECTION 17. INVALID PROVISION

The invalidity or unenforcability of any particular provision of this Agreement shall not affect the other provisions hereof, and this Agreement shall be construed in all respects as if such invalid or unenforceable provision was omitted.

## SECTION 18. SECTIONS AND HEADINGS

Headings in this Agreement are for convenience only and shall not be given effect in the interpretation of this Agreement. Unless otherwise indicated, references to Sections are to Sections of this Agreement.

## SECTION 19. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Ohio and any action brought pursuant to this agreement shall be brought in a court of competent jurisdiction within the State of Ohio.

## SIGNATURES

It is therefore agreed that EWI and the University will cooperate in the field of materials joining in the spirit and manner outlined in this document.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the day and year first set forth above.

THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY
